questions.question: You walk into a crowded room and immediately feel drained or overwhelmed, even though nothing has happened yet:
Watching someone cry in a movie or in real life usually makes you tear up too:
choices: I rarely cry, even at funerals

questions.question: You can often tell what someone is feeling before they say a word—just by their energy or facial micro-expressions:
choices: I need them to tell me

questions.question: After spending time with certain people, you feel exactly how they were feeling (angry, sad, anxious) even though it wasn’t about you:
Loud, chaotic, or highly stimulating places (malls, concerts, parties) make you want to leave after a short time:
choices: Yes, I need to recharge alone afterward

questions.question: You’ve been told by others that you’re “too sensitive” or “feel things too deeply”:
When someone near you is in physical pain (even if they’re hiding it), you often feel a sensation in the same part of your body:
You tend to know when someone is lying or hiding their true feelings:
Being around very negative or toxic people physically exhausts you or makes you feel sick:
choices: Yes, I have to limit exposure

questions.question: You feel a strong pull to help people who are suffering, sometimes even strangers, and it’s hard to walk away:
choices: Yes, it feels like a calling

score.high: Certified True Empath  You don’t just understand feelings—you live them. You’re a human emotional sponge (protect that gift!).
score.medium: Highly Empathic Soul  You feel deeply and pick up on others more than most—classic empath in training.
score.low: Low-to-Moderate Empathy  You care, but you don’t absorb the world’s emotions. You probably have strong boundaries and thick skin—also a superpower!
